snippet: Uhuru Kenyatta, who has been charged with crimes against humanity, was leading by a wide margin, but confusion rose when officials announced a late-night change in tabulating votes.
abstract: Confusion and anxiety plague elections in Kenya as results are delayed by electronic breakdowns and officials announce late-night change in tabulating votes; Uhuru Kenyatta, scion of one of country's most powerful political families, leads by wide margin, but due to election wrinkle may not secure 50 percent of all cast votes required to win, development that may lead to runoff.
lead_paragraph: Uhuru Kenyatta, who has been charged with crimes against humanity, was leading by a wide margin, but confusion rose when officials announced a late-night change in tabulating votes.

headline.seo: Kenyatta Is Ahead in Kenya Vote
headline.main: Kenyan Accused by Rights Court Is Leading Vote
headline.print_headline: Kenyatta Is Ahead in Kenya Election, but Anxiety Is on the Rise
